Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: amit210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Ca'Foscolo from the 17th to the 22nd of March 2012. Our original plan was to check out on the 21st but we liked the place so much that we reduced one day from our Interlaken stay and extended it here in Venice. Location wise the place is great.. very close to Rialto, and just about 10 mins from San Marco. Yet, quiet and peaceful. The interiors are very nice, plush and modern. Furniture, fittings etc.. all great. When we reached venice, we thought we would need to buy some groceries like Milk, bread, butter etc.. since we were traveling with kids and we needed all that... but to our surprise, the place was stocked with everything we could need.. right from bread, milk, butter to meats and cookies, juice, cereals etc... AWESOME! and they replenish whatever you finish! The Hosts - wonderful people. Elisabeth was so helpful and sweet, and so were the others. Very friendly, helpful, informative.. Staying at this place was the best decision.. thanks to my wife who found it online! I would HIGHLY recommend the place to everyone.. family / business / solo / couples.. everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - spacious, everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: Great location - just a 5 minutes from Rialto bridge and 15 minute walk to Saint Marks Square. Room was a 2 bedroom apartment with 2 full bathrooms, large lounge and dining area. Immaculately furnished and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was great and filled us all up until late afternoon - family of 4. Staff spoke perfect English and couldn't have been more helpful - allowed us to use their PC to check in online to come back and booked a water taxi for us. Local Coop supermarket is 5 minute walk away for all the usual food and drinks. The apartment was really quiet, easy to find and better than I expected. I would go as far as to say it is the best accommodation we have ever stayed in on holiday. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Dominique S
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and on-line search, we opted to stay at Ca'Foscolo and we certainly did not regret our choice. This place has everything one could wish for in Venice: perfect location, within 5/10 minutes' walk of all the major sights and yet tucked away in a quiet campo, spacious, modern accommodation, with fully equipped kitchen (dishwasher, washing machine, large fridge-freezer, 4 ring hob + full-size oven, large living-room with 2 settees and satellite TV, excellent modern bathroom, and good-sized bedroom with very comfortable bed and plenty of wardrobe space. You also have your own independently controlled heating/air conditioning. If you add the full breakfast* tray replenished every day and the very warm welcome from the owners, I think this is one of the best holiday apartments my wife and I have ever stayed in. We'll definitely be back!!! * If you want fresh bread for breakfast rather than the pre-packed types provided, there are a couple of excellent bakeries just around the corner in San Lio, 5 minutes' walk away. People with mobility problems should be aware that access is via several flights of stairs, unless of course you are lucky enough to get one of the 2 the ground floor suites. There are 6 suites on what are effectively the 2nd & 3rd floors as the 1st floor is not part of Ca'Foscolo. A little confusing, "a la veniziana"!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suite!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: What a jewel!!! Our family of 6 had two rooms. What a surprise. Each room had two bedrooms, 2 baths, kitchen, dining table for 4, living room, and washing machine. The rooms were the largest and least expensive of the 4 hotels we used during our vacation. Only one room had a canal view with balcony, but who stays in their room to look out the window? The rooms were very clean. Breakfast items were stocked in the room each day and included munchies and water for those meandering Venice walks. The hotel would have been a little difficult to find, but 80 yr. old Mary led us from St. Marks Square to the Residenza--no charge-- just a wonderful Italian being kind to befuddled-looking Americans! Thank you again Mary--wherever you are. There is no lift, so be prepared to carry your own luggage up several landings. The staff was very efficient and helpful. However, their hours are somewhat limited (I think 8-5). The location was very good--5 -10 minutes to St. Marks Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: lohit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very happy with our choice. Venice is a confusing city with a myriad of streets, alleyways and passageways, but thus hotel is very easy to find and just a few minutes away from the Rialto. The environment is lovely, On a quiet square, just a few mins from the the hustle and bustle of shops, restaurants etc. We stayed in the suite on the ground floor which is like a 1 brm services apartment, complete with kitchen (dishwasher, microwave oven, fridge etc), washing machine etc. The decor is modern and practical (mostly Ikea, but well chosen) and the furnishings are comfortable. Breakfast is a tray of goodies (pastries, toast, jam, nutella, cheese, ham, milk, juice etc) in the kitchen that is replenished daily. Service was friendly and courteous, although be aware that reception is only open till 4pm with an emergency contact number for our of hours. This was fine with us as we are quite independent travellers. Would definitely recommend this place, we were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Woww!!!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! This may be the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in (and I stay in a lot of hotels). Venice is a city with very little greenery, but this hotel is the best. The hotel is immaculately clean. The breakfasts are the best breakfasts I've ever had. The problem is avoiding overeating! The coffee was unbelievable, even for Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience for a family”
Reviews.Author: Ecoamy
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4, I was travelling with my parents and my young daughter. We were looking for an apartment to rent and found Residenza Ca'Foscolo - it gave us the benefits of both, some hotel service in an apartment sized space, with a fully functioning kitchen. We had a lot of space, it was great value for the money. The hotel is centrally located, close to St. Mark's Square (Piazza San Marco) and even closer to Ponte Rialto, on the Grand Canal. The owners were fantastic and extremely helpful, especially when asked about local eateries, etc. Will definitely stay with them again when we get back to Venice!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “What a Carnival!”
Reviews.Author: Elemer P
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our first ever Carnival experience unforgettable. For a family of 2+2 the accomodations in the heart of the city was absolutely sumptuous. The combined living/dining room/kitchen was as big, as some rooms at other hotels. Add two separate bedrooms for sleep and we were in heaven. I room breakfast was more than adequate to charge us uo for the day. The bathroom was small, but sufficent with good time-sharing arrangements. Internet service was OK, You couldn't watch YouTube movies, but who cares? Could surf the web and read emails. More than enough. We had a little problem with the heating one night, but it was resolved in 15 min at 10:30pm. Because of the proximity to sites, service and accommodations, we will definitely recommend and come back to Ca'Foscolo. One more thing: do spend the EUR120 for the airport transfer by water taxi. You will arrive in your private water speedboat from the airport to the footsteps of the hotel in 25 min, taking the most unforgettable journey through the lagoons of Venice. There is no comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a family”
Reviews.Author: Leprechaun72
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we often struggle to find decent accommodation at a price that is affordable. Ca'Foscolo is a special find. It is in a great location near Rialto, yet feels private. It's also central enough to be able pop back during a day's sightseeing. The staff could not have been more helpful, giving email instructions in English about how to find the hotel and how to access the room if we arrived after the reception closed, as well as a few tips on family-friendly places to eat. The two-bedroom apartment was immaculately clean with ample bathroom supplies and super-soft fluffy towels. The continental breakfast more than met the needs of our hungry brood and with coffee and a moka pot, the adults were happy too. Don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, comfortable spacious room- very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just visited Residenza Ca'Foscolo and on the whole had a very nice stay. It is a small apartment- with the convenience of a kitchenette and comfortable and spacious. Also, extremely well located- close to the Rialto Bridge, but still a quiet night sleep. Only downside is that the front desk is only open from 9 to 4, there's no concierge etc- but otherwise, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back, perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust786
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the ground floor suite. Great location between st. Marks and Rialto bridge. Rialto is just minutes away. The staff (young lady with dark hair) was extremely helpful! Loved the spacious suite with washer! Enjoyed the hotel so much, it really felt like home. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Chazster35
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely AWESOME. The hostess was incredible, so friendly, spoke to us in both French & English (my partner is Swiss), and recommended a few places to check out while in Venice. The room was the 2 bedroom suite and was absolutely spotless. Comfortable bed, large showers, nice linens, great continental breakfast, and awesome locatoin. I would highly recommend this place to anyone! Great Job. I can't wait to go back here and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very quiet, very classy place”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four (2 teenage daughters) and stayed in a suite in November. It was very roomy and quiet. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was provided in the room. Coffee was great. More than enough for the four of us. The staff was very friendly, spoke excellent English and provided more than enough recommendations to keep us busy for the two days we were there. All major things you'll want to see and do are within 10 minute walk at the most. Very easy 2-3 minute walk from the Rialto bridge..... do pay attention to the directions to watch for the Disney Store and turn left there, otherwise you can get quite turned around. We found many great restaurants and shops very close to the hotel. The hotel staff will also explain where the grocery stores are if you wish to cook yourself. The last day we were there Venice flooded and the hotel had left notices in our room the night before that it would be happening. That morning we donned our wading boots that were provided by the hotel and followed the recommendations from the staff for where the best places to go see and found ourselves wading around St. Marks Sqr flooded with about 2 foot of water. Very unique experience as the day before we were there without the flooding. When we return to Venice we will definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to a few friends. Only minor thing we experienced was a very weak wi-fi signal and was not able to connect much..... but you are in Venice.... log off and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 780Sophie_L_11
Reviews.Content: A gem of a place in the perfect location-a 10 minute walk to St Marks, and although close to the Rialto Bridge, in a very quiet area. The apartment was spacious, clean and the decor was a mixture of contemporary and traditional-the huge Murano glass light in the bedroom was a spectacle! The bed was huge and very comfortable. The kitchen was modern with a dishwasher and washing machine. The owners were there to meet us and show us to the room, and couldn't have been more helpful-and spoke perfect English too. There was a continental breakfast delivered each day to the apartment -can't say I was that keen on the processed ham or the croissants but still enough of everything else to fill you up for a days walking. I would stay here again and thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Ca'Foscolo in September 2011 for two nights. We are a family of 5 with 2 adults and 3 children aged 13, 10 and 6. This is place is amazing. I cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was here. The service is very friendly. We were very lucky and our apartment overlooked the working canal which was just so beautiful to watch the gondolas go by. The apartment was newly renovated and very clean and well appointed. The breakfast supplies were very generous and topped up each day. The wifi worked well and having a washing machine in the room was great. The location of the apartment was also terrific. Very close to Rialto Bridge and also St Marks Square. Lovely places to eat close by and lots of lovely shops to look at. We caught a water taxi the morning we left which was organised by reception and picked us up at the front door. The vaporetto was also easily accessible. We absolutely adored this place. Having travelled quite a lot around the world, this would easily be one of my favourite places that I have stayed. When we are next in Venice, there will be no other place to stay. It was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Abbie B
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about what a wonderful experience we had at this place. It really made our stay in Venice remarkable. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, we had incredible service. In fact, I would stay here for a month or two if I could. It exceeded our expectations in every way. We stayed in Unit 9, which apparently was just recently remolded and you can tell. It's so well done, so clean, very sleek. There were 4 of us, 2 of us took the bedroom and 2 took the pull out couch ( which by the way was very comfortable). Having a washer for our laundry was so helpful, and though we didn't need the dishwasher - if you were cooking here, I can see where this would be advantageous. PROS: Location is great. Super close to Rialto, only a 5 min walk from the bridge. Centrally located to all different areas, and walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, supermarket, etc. We loved the apartment. Newly renovated, clean, updated furniture, comfortable bed and pull out couch, very large rooms, large bathrooms, large shower area (finally - somewhere in Italy with space). AC was in strong working condition, staff were all very helpful and super friendly. Easy to find! Our room looked over the canal and was on the ground level. It was spectacular. We loved opening the windows eating breakfast watching the morning routines of the locals. Affordable! Very reasonable in price. Free wifi! Breakfast snacks included and furnished every morning. CONS: I really don't have any. The only thing that might be considered a con would be the noise in the early mornings over the canal. It can get busy with the boats, gondolas, in and out of the canal and the unit we had was just over the water. It didn't bother us because we're from NYC so we're used to the noise, but some may find it bothersome. The wireless would occasionally go out. When it did, we just asked the front desk to re-set it. It was strong in the mornings and at night, but we found usually had to be re-set around mid-day. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat. I can't wait to go again, and will ask for the same apartment. It's SO AFFORDABLE - it's 100% worth the affordable price. We also had the water taxi pull right up to the hotel on the day of departure and splurged on taking a water taxi to the airport. Best decision ever - highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Joderbyshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Venice. I booked this hotel after reading recommendations on trip advisor. It is only a very short walk from Rialto bridge, we manged two heavy cases and hand luggage. The best part is it's very close to all the goings on of Venice but situated in a place where there is quiet and you're able to sleep. Everything from my e-mails to them to how we find the hotel to departure was excellent. I was a little apprehensive when I realized there would be nobody at reception at 8.30 in the evening however it becomes obvious when you stay there, there is no need for anybody to be there. Our room was on the second floor and although our view was brick walls it in no detracted from our stay. It was an apartment that had a dishwasher, washing machine and a kitchen supplied well enough to cook in (although we never did). They even left us dishwasher and washing powder!! The young lady in reception (sorry can't remember name, long dark hair!) was most helpful and very friendly, always had a smile on her face. I would happily recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again if I were to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: travelplanner057
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 teenage children for 3 nights in July and we all thought it was very comfortable, very spacious, very clean and very well situated. I was really pleasantly surprised - having been expecting Venice to be very expensive - this was good value - good facilities - washing machine was particularly appreciated. Amazingly close to the busy shopping streets and St Marks Square but a few steps off the main drag it was very quiet. Even in the peak of summer. One look at St Marks Square was enough and we spent the rest of the time sticking to the back streets and quieter neighbourhoods. Did a good walking tour with Fiona Guisto. If you have to come at peak time like us, i suggest this accommodation - esp for a family and a walking tour in the quieter areas.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: o9001kings
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August and it was fabulous. First, the location is awesome!! It is a 2 min. walk from the Rialto Bridge and very close to San Marco square and centrally located to almost anywhere. The room was clean and spacious. The beds were very comfortable and also had a small kitchen. We stayed in rm. #9 which is on the first floor and it was great, because we didn't have to go up the many flights of stairs since there is no elevator. Our room was on the canal and we could see the gondolas passing by. Everything was modern and very clean....even a washing machine too. Roberta was great.....she is very knowledgeable and she even made our reservations to see an opera...The Barber of Seville....it was AWESOME!! We can't wait to go back.....I highly recommend this place...It is like having your own apartment in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Aisia A
Reviews.Content: Way better then any Marriott! Excellent service and warm hospitality. Free snacks and wifi. Entire kitchenette with dishwasher, refrigerator, and sink. Comfortable beds and spacious rooms! Would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartment in center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: mhphillips
Reviews.Content: What a really great place to stay in Venice! Half way between the Rialto and Piazza S. Marco. Location, location, location. We were a party of two men and two women. Paying for two separate hotel rooms in the heart of Venice was really beyond our budget. So the Ca' Foscolo apartment was the perfect solution. It had two double bedrooms, two full baths, kitchen, dining area and living room. All very modern and well appointed. Bedrooms each had a full wall of built-in modern closets/cupboards/drawers. The kitchen was stocked with breakfast fixings, including expresso coffee, which the staff renewed daily as we used them. Air conditioning worked fine, although in May we used it only to take the edge off. So what's not to like? Maybe the no-elevator climb to the top floor -- whew! This unit is not for anyone not in good shape. Also, internet access on the top floor was nil, so we -- and others -- congregated in a small shared lobby serving several of the apartments where the wi-fi connection was strong. The good news is that wi-fi was free. One afternoon, we could hear a lovely concert from the church next door -- bonus! If we ever are lucky enough to return to Venice, we would definitely stay at Ca' Foscolo again.

Reviews.Title: “WE can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: maya43
Reviews.Content: Best apartment/hotel we stayed in our Spain Italy trip. Very well located. Roberta was very friendly and knowledgeable. Rooms were impeccably clean and updated. Great pizza by the slice place nearby. The staff had stocked the kitchen with a good variety for an adequate breakfast. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: I_Weir
Reviews.Content: Very clean and spacious apartment - 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom apartment with a large living room with small kitchen. Good central location (3 minutes by foot from Rialto bridge and 10 minutes from Piazzo San Marco). Nice to have fridge and cooking facilites. Food for breakfast is left in the kitchen, (cereal, croisants, milk, cheese, ham, juice, pastry & bread) Reception staff very helpful and had excellent English. Tip - We got an excellent meal in the 'Da Mama' restaurant on alleyway leading to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Timkyungah
Reviews.Content: An excellent location 3 minutes walk from Rialto and less than 10 minutes from Marco Square. Large residential rooms with ample space for 4 people. Fantastic to be in the room next to the canal watching gondolas sail by all day - although a little noisy in the morning when the garbage boat arrives. Super kind service from Roberta in reception. If we again go to Venice entire family, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: scranger
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms within easy walking distance of Piazzo San Marco and Ponte de Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: njshore07
Reviews.Content: While a little hard to find, this hotel is in a very convenient location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of our room, which was actually a little suite with a kitchenette and living area and then a bed room and bathroom in a separate room. The "double bed" that we'd requested was really just two singles pushed together, but we found this to be true of many of the hotels we stayed in during our time in Italy. This hotel wasn't anything fancy but it was certainly a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: Abhilash S
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels that I will remember for rest of my life. We reached late in the night from Rome by Train. We have booked this hotel through a website. On the door they have a slip in our name. When we entered we heard a voice please come upstairs. When we met the person we felt so comfortable. When we have seen the room we were so happy as it was a apartment and they have a kitchen also and we can cook Indian Food on our own. It is situated near to a canal and you may sit and see people doing Gondola Rides. When the hotel people know that it was our honeymoon they kept a bottle champagne in our room on the second day when we went for the sightseeing. Very close to the center of Venice. I would highly recommended Residenza Favaro.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: momofmombo
Reviews.Content: We changed hotels in venice online at the last minute because of what I read on trip advisor. we were not disappointed. Lovely apartment with kitchen and washer in the heart of Venice. owners are wonderful... Would definitely stay here again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: meetabhutani
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a 2 room apartment for 3 nights . it was very clean..full amenities and very close to both rialto and San Marco! it was a very nice and quiet neighborhood! they have a private pier which was very convenient for us since we had an early morning flight and the water taxi came right to our door step! there is no elevator which is the only drawback so if you are ready to carry your luggage up-to the 2nd floor its a gem!!!!!! Patrizia was very warm and helpful...she provided us with gum boots for the high tide which was a life saver!!!! thank you Patrizia for making our stay memorable! will come again:)

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs2
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at Residenza Ca' Foscolo in September 2010. It was a great location, only a few minutes walk to the Rialto bridge and about a 10 minute walk to San Marco square. We caught a water taxi from the train station for 50 euro, which we thought was quite good as we were told it could be about 70 euro. The accomodation was very clean and spacious and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was at the sister hotel, Hotel Bruno, which was only a 5 minute walk away. We also did a walking tour of Venice, which we booked through Viator, and we would recomend doing this as it was very imformative and it also helps you find your way around if you have not been to venice before. There is also a great little restaurant on the other side of rialto bridge, just at the foot of the stairs crossing over the bridge. The view from there at night is just gorgeous!! We loved Venice and would definately stay at Residenza Ca' Foscolo again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gkashar
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed all aspects of our stay. The room are clean and comfortable. We were traveling with three children, so the extra space and kitchen were much appreciated. Each of the rooms has an air conditioner, which was appreciated at the end of August. The staff was efficient and helpful and gave us a few good restaurant recommendations. For more detailed requests, we talked to the conciege at Hotel Bruno, which owns the property. The location is excellent, a few minutes walk to the Rialto bridge and less than 10 minutes to St. Marks. We took water taxis to and from the train station and they are able to pull up right next to the front door, which was very convenient for us hauling luggage for the family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place. good value”
Reviews.Author: mattriand
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Cafoscolo after a long journey from Australia, landing in Milan and getting the train straight to Venice. The water taxi from the station was 60 euros but we were tired. it turned out to be a GREAT way to arrive at the apartments and into Venice. worth it. Paulo and Patrizia are both really lovely people who are freindly and professional. The apartment was spacious and had all the things we needed. the free wifi was a added bonus.The location felt 'local' yet it was minutes to everything. venice can be very expensive but cafoscolo offer great value. when in venice do yourself a favor and go walking in the 'wrong' direction at night. get lost. its quite remarkable how many people DONT make the effort to walk off the main tourist areas. the quite neighborhoods reveal their magic to anyone that cares to make the effort. true, blissful magic awaits. it really does... as for cafoscolo. stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “We Really Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late April 2010. We loved our room, the location and the service we received. We would be happy to return on our next trip. The one bedroom apartment was a good size, much bigger than a hotel room and great to have a kitchen and washing machine. We bought fresh seafood and pasta at the Rialto markets and cooked up a feast in our apartment. It was a good change as we were away for a month and we had been eating out almost every night. We stayed for 3 nights. We caught public transport in from the train station and found the hotel reasonably easy with the provided hotel map we received in email when we booked. We got a private water taxi in departure which Patrizia organize for us. It was a good way and hassle free way of getting to the airport. A tad more expensive, but its good to splurge sometimes. We got a little bit of noise from the outside campo one night, but wasn't too bad. We hope to come back soon and would like to thank the hotel owners again, Paolo and Patrizia for such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: lika_28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a week in March 2010 and we were looking for somewhere central, that didn't cost a fortune and somewhere that would actually give us a bit of space. Having looked at many of the hotels in Venice I realised that I'd either have to spend a fortune or really compromise on space (some rooms I'd seen photos of practically had the bathroom in the bedroom), not so with Ca'Foscolo! We stayed in Apartment 2 and honestly couldn't have asked for anything more. From arrival we were impressed that Paulo took the time to mark on a map where the local supermarket was along with wine shops, a takeaway pizza place (Crazy Pizza, love it!) and local restaurants. The apartment (2 - a double bed apartment) was lovely and spacious (photos attached) and we couldn't have been more impressed. One of the best bits was the fact that we had access to a kitchen which meant that in a morning we could enjoy a cup of tea and fresh bread bought from a local bakery. Although service of the apartment is only every 3 days you can pay an extra 50euros for daily service, we didn't bother though and in fact it was quite nice to not feel like you had to vacate the room for a certain time everyday so that the room could be cleaned, we felt like we were at home. The location is fantastic and ony minutes from the Rialto and St Mark's which meant that so much of the city was accessible on foot with practically no effort. There are also no end of good restaurants in the vicinity. It's the little touches that made this place so special like the fact that they have welington boots to borrow if acqua alta becomes a possibility or the fact that you get to walk in and see gondolas float by the boat entrance to the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for families with any age of children!”
Reviews.Author: SmiggsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca'Foscolo in the two bedroom, one bath, kitchen with sitting and dining room unit. What an oasis! My husband, three children (ages 13, 11, and 9) and I loved spreading out to the two bedrooms and the pull out couch for the first time since arriving in Europe. The apartment was clean, fully-functioning , and well-managed. We caught up on laundry one small load at a time. We shopped at the nearby Rialto open market for delicious fresh foods and then cooked them at the apartment . They were some of our favorite meals from our entire trip. The staff is very friendly and helpful without being intrusive. Use their maps to find the residence. You will need them, especially if you arrive at night and take the vaporetto from the train station. Water taxis are much more expensive than the vaporetto, and the vaporettos provide a lovely ride with a short walk to the residence. We bought several three-day vaporetto passes and used them almost exclusively to get around Venice. My kids loved riding them. You can't go wrong with Ca Foscolo if you are traveling with a group and you want the option of cooking in with fresh Italian ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located and elegant”
Reviews.Author: mountforest
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italian trip with 2 teenagers. Arrived via public transport - no problem. Had been delayed so were arriving after dark so stopped in at Hotel Bruno to get keys. Staff at Residenza saw us approach and called from upper window -- voice from heavens! Kids thought lower floor was creepy but we thought it all added to the experience! So much more interesting than just a regular lobby .. how often do gondolas float by a lobby!??! Was great to be able to come and go throughout the day as the location is prefect for exploring the area. Came back for lunch, back before dinner and then to get warmer clothes before heading to San Marco square to listen to the bands! Our apartment did not have a washer - would have very nice! The 'twin beds' turned out to be 2 mattresses in one bedframe done up in separate bedding but basicaly one bed! Our teenagers of different genders dealt with it but it wasn't what we expected. The one bathroom had to be the smallest one I've ever seen but it was very clean and sufficient. The sofa bed sqeaked but it was comfortable. The location is very central but the alley between Hotel Bruno and the Residenza is very dark and deserted-feeling. Returning in the evening after the few shops had closed up was kind of creepy. I realize that Venice is a pretty safe city but I would not have wanted head down the alley as a single female after dark. Better to come at it from Rialto. Would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and size”
Reviews.Author: photomom89
Reviews.Content: We were there a few years ago with our three children. This apartment was beyond perfect, felt like we were living in Venice, not just visiting. The apartment was spacious, never felt crowded and the staff was so helpful. I meant to write this a few years ago. We would for sure stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Ca'Foscolo
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5526, 30122 Venice, Italy
